review_text: Fayetteville, is a military town with limited attractions. This home was a home away from home. A central location with everything within a 5 minute driving distance. We were there to celebrate a graduation and Mother’s Day and loved the home. The place is even nicer in person than in pictures. Host literally thinks of the small details one can forget on a trip and has them there. The towels are white, I mean white like you would expect at a 5 star hotel. I recommend to anyone that appreciates a comfortable place like there home and will care for it as there own because the house is very nice and beds are comfortable.

If we ever have a need to return to Fayetteville, we would love to stay in your home again!

Group trip
review_text:
Bella’s place was nothing short of amazing! I originally booked her home for my aunts who are older (60’s plus) after a long drive from FL. As soon as we walked in, we were greeted by a warm open concept. The updated touches (master shower), kitchen amenities, and convenient bathroom in the back bedroom) we’re just AWESOME. I would honestly book this place again just for me. I also recommend anyone else to book and stay here.
Lastly, Bella was SO flexible with communication and reservation. I had to add an additional day to the stay last minute, which she approved promptly and when we checked out my aunt left her cell phone in the home after the door codes had changed. Bella gave us a new code to access the door and my aunt was able to get her belongings. The cleaners were present so I was originally weary, because I have had bad experiences with cleaners stealing guests items. This was NOT the case! Thank you to Bella ! this was the perfect accommodation for my family. 10/10 .

Bella had everything well stocked and there were really no issues I needed to contact her about. Definitely recommend!

review_text: Bella’s place was exactly as the photos portrayed it to be and then some. This only the second time staying at an Airbnb and was a little nervous because it looked so nice compared to others I was reviewing for our stay. She was very helpful and sent someone right over when we had issues with the code for the door. She allowed us to have family over for a celebration meal. There are no pictures of the backyard in her listing so I do want to mention it was very accommodating for my family and guests. There is a basketball hoop, volleyball, picnic table, large patio table and grill. Having 3 bathrooms was very convenient. There were essentials there to get us through a few days so we didn’t have to run right out to the store. The home is updated, very clean and comfortable. The furniture was new and comfy along with the beds. Thank you Bella for opening up this home for us to have some much needed family time.

We had everything we needed to keep us comfortable, the kitchen had all the appliances we needed, the bathroom had all the essentials we forgot to bring, and I loved that the washer/dryer was right in the unit! Also the neighbors were friendly and we felt right at home. When we are back in the Fayetteville area we'll definitely stay here again!

It was personable and private.The off street parking was a bit of a challenge, but was totally manageable. Carli, the host, made me feel right at home. She truly is a good person and has a real heart of hospitality. It is clear to me that she loves inviting people to experience her beautiful oasis. Her place is second to none!!! She has taken time to cross every “t” and dot every “i”. When traveling, it’s easy to forget to pack something or have a last minute need. Well, at this place…if you can think of it, it is there. From the clear precise instructions to the fully loaded kitchen cabinets. Thank you Carli for sharing your place and your heart. I would definitely re-visit and will definitely remember experiencing this visit to Carli’s Cozy Place.

Her cottage was beyond clean and well appointed. This was my first trip since the pandemic started and I was not concerned once I stepped foot in this little paradise in the woods. It was a peaceful place to rest and recharge after a busy day of house hunting. Carli is so quick to respond to questions before my visit and during though I had only a few and that was because I did not understand how to work the TVs and she came so quickly just to make sure I knew how it worked since I knew nothing except what I was accustomed to and that was cable. I would 100% recommend Carli as your host should you visit Fayetteville, North Carolina. I am so pleased that I chose her cozy, roomy cottage. If I could give her a 10 star rating, I would!

name: Sacha

review_text:
My recent stay at "The Cottage" in Fayetteville, North Carolina, hosted by the incredible Connie, was an absolute delight—the Airbnb seamlessly blended style and comfort, from its spotless interiors to the thoughtful decor. Our super host, Connie, contributed to the exceptional experience with a warm welcome and detailed instructions that made every aspect of the stay easy.
"The Cottage" is a true haven of relaxation, featuring a well-appointed kitchen and cozy living spaces, including a comfortable and tranquil outdoor area. Connie's meticulous attention to detail is evident throughout, creating an elegant and inviting atmosphere.
The location couldn't be more ideal, offering convenient access to Fayetteville's attractions and amenities. During my visit to family in the area, the home served as the perfect base for exploring the city or enjoying the peacefulness of the neighborhood. I felt perfectly situated for a thoroughly enjoyable stay.

rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: When I wrote my previous review in August 2022, I said, “….it may come as no surprise that I will DEFINITELY put this cottage at the top of my list to check, and cross my fingers, for availability whenever I come to the Fayetteville area!” Since I am writing my SECOND review, I STOOD BY that statement! 😃 I planned my 2023 travel dates for six nights lodging for when the cottage had availability. THAT says A LOT! In having the intent to make an annual trip to visit a wonderful cat rescue in St. Pauls that I sponsor, I will continue to work the timing of my travel dates to align with when the cottage is available. Free guaranteed parking, easy access with keypad, overall very clean and uncluttered (even outside on the covered porch that I LOVE!), comfortable beds, safe area, close to retail/restaurants/highway, stocked with some food/beverage for breakfast and I used washer/dryer. Recommend using coffee filters instead of the filter basket. Connie is quick to respond.

First of all, I hesitate to share what I believe to be the best kept secret in Fayetteville! Because I don’t want it to be booked each time I come to town! It’s the sweetest and most comfortable, affordable, and well located Airb&b in the area. I’m in love!
Connie is a super friendly and accommodating host. She responded right away to my questions and was attentive to our needs.
The photos don’t do the cottage justice because it’s far more cute, homey, well decorated and stylish than the photos reveal.
The private porch is so cozy and, at night, even magical and serene with its dim lighting and waterfall for ambiance. My favorite space for sure!
The kitchen is fully stocked for cooking in, and updated with the cutest modern amenities. My favorite room in the house!
The bathroom has THE BEST walk in tile shower big enough for two people. My favorite feature for sure!
Another great detail is the central location to restaurants and shopping. Five minutes to anything you need.

review_text:
Connie's Cottage was immaculately clean, real tile in the bathroom and laundry room, and freshly finished Oak Hardwood floors throughout the rest of the house.
The beds are comfortable, the couch pleasant to read on, as well as a nice assortment of other furniture and decorations. A look thru the kitchen showed a good assortment of pans, dishes and modern appliances; although I did not make any meals.
Connie was very quick to respond to any communication or questions leading up to the stay. I never had any issues once in the house but I can safely assume she would have just as quickly responded to and fixed any issues found.
The house came with some breakfast items and cold bottled water in the fridge.
The neighborhood was quiet and we had no disturbance during the stay. There was off-street parking just behind the house with my car visible out of the bedroom window.
If I or any of my friends need a place in Fayetteville I will look to see if Connie has anything available.

review_text:
What a wonderful cottage and COVERED PORCH! Oh my gosh that porch is the BEST! Stayed comfortable with the option to use the ceiling fan and neither my friend or I got wet lounging on the porch while it was raining hard.
Everything was “EASY” at the cottage….keypad/lock worked well, entire home and porch were VERY clean, it is sufficiently stocked, quick response from Connie when I asked if she had a few baggies I could use (she provided me with a whole new box), retail/restaurants/highway are very close by (while the neighborhood is QUIET), parking area is guaranteed on the back side of the cottage, Air Conditioning and ceiling fans available, plenty of pillows (I think they all are foam, I bring my feather pillow when I travel as it’s what works better for me :-), the beds are comfortable…..so it may come as no surprise that I will DEFINITELY put this cottage at the top of my list to check, and cross my fingers, for availability whenever I come to the Fayetteville area!
Connie’s rules are totally reasonable and I did my part to leave the cottage as close as I could to when I arrived so she can keep the cleaning fee low for guests. Thanks much, Connie!

name: Mike
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
February 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Nobody likes third party booking, and I'm pretty sure Airbnb doesn't like it either since it makes communication and accurate reviews difficult if not altogether impossible. However, with upfront honesty and a promise to maintain excellent communication throughout Connie took a chance with us, and we're certainly thankful she did. We flew one of our authors in from out of town in order to participate in a lecture and book signing event. Being from the area, we know where the best places in town are to stay, and that's why we selected the Cottage. This place is an absolute gem and our guest author was amazed by the accommodations we were able to provide thanks to Connie. The guest's flight was a disaster and by the time he arrived he was tired and hungry and in no mood to venture back out for food. Connie had provided a well stocked fridge full of goodies and coffee for the morning. Wow! A really nice touch one doesn't usually find in other Airbnbs. The place is immaculately decorated and extremely clean. The outside covered porch is an oasis of its own and very relaxing. The beds are super comfortable and the place is just the right size; not too big and certainly not cramped. But best of all, Connie provides value at a time when a lot of folks need it. The Cottage is comparable to other Airbnbs costing much more with less experienced hosts. If you're lucky enough to find some space on Connie's calendar, you won't be disappointed.

Stayed with kids
review_text: This was a great place to stay! The house is lovely, modern, and clean. All amenities were available as advertised and easy to locate. Location was super convenient for access to the highway, but far enough to not hear road noise. Be advised that there is a bright street light that shines through a beautiful arched window in the primary bedroom. The lower window has blinds and curtains, but there is still a significant amount of light through the upper window. My wife and I use sleeping masks regularly and this light did not pose a problem. Anyone with sensitivity to perfumed detergents, be advised that just the primary bed sheets and/or comforter had a clean but distinct scent which was a minor annoyance to us, but could be a problem for some. Overall, excellent!

Angela

review_text:
We had house work being done so this was the perfect place to do a quick stay while that was happening. Host was responsive and accommodating to an early check in based on our schedule. Great backyard for the dog. The kitchen wasn’t as well stocked as the listing made it seem -no basics like cooking oil, almost no foil, no extra paper towels, and very limited pots and pans. Wasn’t a huge deal since we could grab stuff from our house but a bit inconvenient to do so. Also could be a little cleaner especially bathrooms but it wasn’t too bad. If your pets are escape artist you do have to be careful of some loose fence post but the backyard was amazing and for most pets no issues…ours is just a determine dog.
Overall I would recommend! Super appreciative of the flexibility and responsiveness.

review_text: Nicolas was very communicative, no problem there. However, the house was not clean like I would have liked it. Mind u, im not one to complain but it was a mess. We walked in the house and u couldnt even smell any type of cleaning products, i do mean nothing! The mirror in the bedroom is caked up with dust like it hasn't been cleaned in months! There is so much trash and rose petals under the beds. The couch had trash in the cushions. The fridge was NOT cleaned out. Had somebody's leftovers and stuff in it. The laundry detergent container was absolutely empty, thank goodness I brought some laundry pods of my own. Every other dish and cup I pulled out the cabinet had to be washed as it was noticeably dirty. The mattresses do not have a mattress casing or anything so the mattresses are pretty disgusting. We ended up sleeping on the couch. Pool table was great, the sticks don't have hardly any tips left so can't really use the chalk so that part sucked. The dogs did love the big yard!

review_text: We were coming from California to visit our daughter who is stationed at Ft. Bragg. With the home only 10 minutes away from the base and restaurants, it was great. We loved the nature surrounding the house. Lots of trees, a quiet street, and so much greenery. Waking up in the morning to birds chirping on the lawn and squirrels playing just outside the windows. We were able to cook meals as the kitchen has pots, pans, nice plates, bowls, and silverware. We hosted a small dinner to celebrate my daughter's birthday and having the pool table and board games were a hit! The host was very responsive to the few questions I had during the trip. Anyone visiting their child at Ft. Bragg should consider their stay here.

review_text: Needed a place to stop for a night on the way to Charleston with the pups and the house was perfect. Easy access to the highway but in a quiet neighborhood - important to note that I felt very safe here :) There’s a couple of small restaurants within walking distance around the corner and it’s also about a 4-mile drive up the road to a ton of restaurants/shopping. The house is immaculately clean and the yard was HUGE with a secure fence - the pups really enjoyed exploring. The outside space was perfect to unwind after 9 hours in the car from PA. Exactly what I needed without breaking the bank - would absolutely stay here again. Thanks for sharing your home, Nick!

This house is easy to get to and the neighborhood was quiet. It rained while we were there so we didn’t use any of the outdoor amenities. The beds were comfortable. We’d recommend this property.
Two things to note: we could find only two wash cloths and two towels in the house. You may want to bring extra linens. Also, the living room is sunken with steps leading into and out of the space. We were fine with it but it wouldn’t be ideal for anyone with stability/mobility issues.

Stayed with a pet
review_text: This is an adorable tiny home on a beautiful property and was a convenient, pet-friendly stay during our travels! Reta is very friendly and accommodating and responded quickly to our questions! Clean and roomy even with two small dogs. Amazing shower with a wrap-around door and great water pressure. We were very happy with our overnight stay with the exception that I just did not find the full-size, pull-out bed to be comfortable. :( (Note: My partner said he was comfortable, but I felt like I was sleeping on a rock.) Most reviewers don’t mention the bed - noting for those who need more comfort. Hope an improvement is made on the mattress/bed. Would love to stay again. Everything else is 10/10!

Our stay at Reta's Tiny Farm House was wonderful. The location was very convenient to I-95, and the perfect place to stop for a night as we headed farther south.
Reta was a terrific communicator, and everything was clean and ready for us upon arrival. It's a small space, but exactly as described and perfect for the two of us to get some rest after a long day on the road. The cookies and other drinks/snacks provided were a nice bonus!
I would definitely stay at Reta's place in the future, especially for the value and quiet surroundings.

review_text: This place was beautiful. Adequate towels and toiletries. Everything squeaky clean. Loved being able to walk. There was a huge dog at the end of the one path that scared the begezies out of me. He was loose and huge, he didn’t come up to us but we scurried away from him. Honestly don’t know if the dog belonged to the host. The property and the tiny house are truly unique. Unfortunately we arrived later than we would have liked and only spent one night but we were able to get a nice mile walk in. I would recommend the place for sure and would love to visit again.

review_text:
My fiancé and I were traveling from upstate NY to FL to move with our three kitties. We were so beyond grateful to have found this gem as a great half way point for our trip. The directions Reta provided were very clear to get to the Airbnb. Great sign right down the driveway to guide you to where to park and lead right up to the front door.
The Airbnb was more than what we expected and we were beyond pleased with the pull out couch (super comfy) and amenities of the place. Super quiet and peaceful night. Only regret is we wish we had more time to walk around and explore the beautiful scenery and enjoy the seating around the fire area that’s right outside the tiny home. This stay really helped us get thru the rest of our trip the following day.
Would absolutely stay here again ◡̈

Stayed with a pet
review_text: Reta's place was incredible! It is in a beautiful setting, right out of a movie. Reta's family owns a tree farm and the walking paths surrounding it are amazing! However, the sleeping arrangements do need to be discussed. I was lucky as there was only me and my dog (with her pillow). I am not sure how two people or folks with limited mobility would have been able to sleep on the "chair beds". Yes, the pictures on the posting make it look easy to change the chairs into beds. There is also a set of directions on a sheet of household informational tidbits like wifi, etc.. However, I was unsuccessful and used one of the mattresses I found. After driving all day and two Tylenol PM, I was ready to sleep anywhere. I am not sharing this info to keep anyone from staying here. I just think a more realistic description of the sleeping arrangements needs to be shared.

name: V
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
November 2022
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text: Our group of three had to cancel our booking at another location and needed to find a place to stay at the last minute. By luck this tiny house had just been listed and even though it had no reviews (at the time) we contacted the host to see if it would be right for our needs and after a quick exchange we went ahead and booked it for two different stays. We were a bit nervous at the idea of being one of the first guests to stay at this location, but we had absolutely nothing to worry about. The property is just a few short minutes off I-95 surrounded by trees and away from all the noise. A code is needed to check in which our hosts sent to us before we arrived and we were able to park directly next to the house itself. A note was waiting for us with a contact number that we actually had to use because we couldn't figure out how to work the tv (which is set up with Roku and Netflix). Not only were the hosts more than happy to help resolve the issue but they wasted no time to get it fixed; when we walked through the door on our second stay the tv was set up and ready to go! There are three sleeper chairs with linens, but an air mattress is offered as a substitute for one of the chairs and a queen sized bed in a separate area can also be used at no extra charge which really goes to show how much the hosts care about the comfort of their guests. There's a kitchenette sink, mini fridge, and stove combo as well as a small microwave and two coffee machines (k-cup and standard). The kitchen provides cups, cutlery, plates, a few cooking utensils, and a convertible table that seats two. The bathroom is roomy, has plenty of towels, and the walk-in shower has consistent hot water with good pressure. What we really appreciated were the small touches such as the snacks/candy on the kitchen table, the waters and sodas stocked in the fridge, the board game in the main area, and the fire wood for the outside pit; on our second stay there were sugars and creamers available as well as body wash and shampoo/conditioner in addition to everything else. However, nothing will highlight how kind and generous these hosts are more than the message we got from them between our stays asking after our well being as they knew we were in Florida at the time Nicole was passing through the state. It was an absolute joy to stay at the tiny house with these hosts and we highly recommend others to stay here whether it's for one night or an extended stay.

Group trip
review_text:
If I could place a title on this review it would be called Laughing Out Loud. My family and I always have so much fun and we laugh a lot...loudly. One moment while laughing, I quieted myself and thought I may be too loud (as if in a hotel and possibly disturbing the other guests). Then I realized that I was at "home."
I can't say enough about the hospitality we received during our stay. From the beginning to end, our hosts were very responsive. They went above and beyond to ensure that we had a pleasant stay.
The little amenities in this home made the biggest difference. Suitcase racks, the good felt hangers, laundry baskets, mints, tissues, water, coffee...and towels, towels, and more towels. We were well taken care of!
This house gave my family a chance to be together for my mom's 70th birthday. Beyond all the little touches, the greatest touch was that it was filled with love and peace. We would definitely stay again! Thank you Rodney and Seante'!

We initially came to visit family which unexpectedly turned into making funeral arrangements as a family member passed. Seante allowed us to extend our reservation and add family as events unfolded and expressed their sympathy for our loss.
The house was very clean, beyond well stocked, comfortable, and very close to numerous places in Fayetteville. One of our family members said that they had the softest towels in the world here. This place is one we will reserve again for future trips to Fayetteville. Thank you again Rodney and Seante for the beautiful home and adding a human touch in a difficult time in our lives.

,

Group trip
review_text:
I don’t even know where to begin!
We booked this stay for 6 people (3 couples) 2 of us were celebrating our 22nd birthday on New Year’s Day, and we were spending this weekend with the people we loved. Rodney and Seante’s house was PERFECT for this. When we arrived Seante greeted us to give us a personal tour of the home. She made sure we knew where everything was located, and what to expect of our stay. They graciously provided tips about local restaurants and activities in a binder in the living room, left Shampoo Conditioner, body wash, makeup wipes, razors and a travel toothbrush in both bathrooms in case you forgot your own. I think I speak for the 3 women in our household that we loved that they left makeup wipes and even had darker wash cloths to wash our face with so we didn’t have to worry about messing up their white towels. Everything was amazing, I could go on and on about the small details, but instead I’ll give you the big picture. If you are looking for somewhere charming and affordable this is your place! We were less than 5 minutes from town.
I will say that they were very responsive to anything we may have needed from them and all in all they made us feel so very welcome. If I find myself in Fayetteville again I know EXACTLY where I’ll be staying.
Thank you Rodney and Seante for such a wonderful stay!!

Group trip
review_text: We stayed at Katie's house for my sister's baby shower weekend and it was absolutely perfect. Each bedroom had it's own bathroom with an additional half bath, the kitchen was very spacious and invited people in to sit around the bar and talk, the sun room was where my mom woke up and read every morning and the cleanliness of the home was beautiful. She had coffee ready to go, clean sheets and towels and it truly felt perfect for me and my four sisters.

We were in the area for a wedding. This was a perfect location for our needs as we were less than 2 miles from the wedding venue.
The property was as just as described, very clean, and spacious. Each bedroom provided privacy and a comfortable mattress/linens.

review_text:
We fell in love with the Blake Cottage and I will be back! My family lives nearby, so I'm probably a little biased, but we loved this place! It is stocked with a full setup for multiple guests in rooms that also rent separately. Plenty of parking and porch seating, and there's a friendly neighborhood floppy eared bunny that visits occasionally 🐇 😂
Seriously though this place is great. It is super clean, modern, with fast internet, and the air conditioning works really well. Right near 95 if you're looking for a quick stop on the way!
I'll be back!
